definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

pinyin: Zhong1 Shi2 you2 Chuan1 dong1 Zuan4 tan4 Gong1 si1

sentences.english: By the first century BC the Chinese had developed the technology for deep drilling boreholes.
sentences.chinese: 公元前一世纪，中国人已经发明了深井钻探技术。

sentences.english: Barite was found as inclusions in garnet of eclogite from the main borehole core of the Chinese Continental Scientific Drilling.
sentences.chinese: 在中国大陆科学钻探主孔榴辉岩中发现了重晶石。

sentences.english: Drillers and blasters often perform both drilling and blasting activities.
sentences.chinese: 钻井工人和爆破手经常进行钻探及爆破活动。

sentences.english: Instead, he told us to go drilling.
sentences.chinese: 相反，他告诉我们去钻探。

sentences.english: Once the drilling is complete, the shape of the round holes are modified by a milling operation which increases the valved area.
sentences.chinese: 一旦钻探完成，该圆孔形状修改碎行动瓣面积增加。

sentences.english: If they are disappointed at one place , the drillers go to another .
sentences.chinese: 如果他们在一个地方失望，钻探者会去另一个地方。

sentences.english: Western oil majors have recently reported a rise in the drilling failure rate.
sentences.chinese: 西方石油大鳄们最近报告说钻探失败率在上升。

sentences.english: The number of drill rigs actively drilling for gas has barely budged, though it has been down in the US three of the last four weeks.
sentences.chinese: 积极进行天然气钻探的钻井数量也几乎未发生变化。

sentences.english: We shall have more rigs in a year.
sentences.chinese: 一年后咱们将有更多的钻探机。

sentences.english: As the diamond tip of the drill revolves, it is lubricated by mud.
sentences.chinese: 钻探机的金钢石钻头转动时，由泥浆起润滑作用。

sentences.english: Technology and economics of drilling in the region are evaluated.
sentences.chinese: 评述了东方站地区钻探的技术经济指标。

sentences.english: Paste with high copper content and solid lubricants for the lubrication of drilling equipment.
sentences.chinese: 高铜粉含量固体润滑剂，用于润滑钻探设备。

sentences.english: The importance and application of a new type pneumatic drill in drilling are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了风钻在凿岩和钻探技术中的重要性和应用。

sentences.english: Most excited of all, though, are oil-drillers and shipping companies.
sentences.chinese: 然而最兴奋者是石油钻探者和航运公司。

sentences.english: Lights from offshore drilling platforms twinkled on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 近海钻探平台的灯光在海平线上闪动着。

sentences.english: Scientists had long known that magma chambers must lie in the vicinity of the drill site.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们了解到岩浆房一定就在钻探地的附近。

definition: to explore/to survey/to prospect (for oil etc)/prospecting
to prospect/to dig for coal or minerals
vertical shaft (for mining, ventilation systems etc)
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
to extract (ore or other resource from a mine)/to exploit/to mine
